messages.subject: Re: Oregon Public Broadcasting (OPB)
messages.msgSnippet: ... tv ... Unschoolers ... I heard you!  Mary Gold wasn t on the show.  No other whole life unschoolers were on.  It was really more the eclectic
messages.messageBody:
> I called in :) I can't wait to listen to the whole show, I missed Mary
> Gold's interview and heard only the "within my parameters" and "limit
tv"
> and "free school" talks... I wondered if any other Whole Life
Unschoolers
> were gonna be on...


I heard you! Mary Gold wasn't on the show. No other whole life
unschoolers were on. It was really more the eclectic homeschoolers or
those that only unschool academics, but require chores etc.

It was a little disappointing because they seemed to miss the whole darn
point of unschooling!

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Oregon Public Broadcasting (OPB)
messages.msgSnippet: I called in :) I can t wait to listen to the whole show, I missed Mary Gold s interview and heard only the within my parameters and limit tv and free
messages.messageBody:
I called in :) I can't wait to listen to the whole show, I missed Mary
Gold's interview and heard only the "within my parameters" and "limit tv"
and "free school" talks... I wondered if any other Whole Life Unschoolers
were gonna be on...

On Tue, Aug 5, 2008 at 1:12 AM, MLewis <m9f9l@...> wrote:

> ran a program this evening on unschooling and I caught just the last
> couple minutes. It was the Think Out Loud program and so I went to the
> website. I'm finding on their message board that a lot of responses
> from "unschoolers" are not describing unschooling as I know it. But if
> you click on the highlighted word 'advocates' in the opb text you get
> Sandra's website homepage, which is nice ;-) I haven't felt like
> responding myself yet.....
>
>


I'm formulating too :)
--
~diana :)

messages.subject: Oregon Public Broadcasting (OPB)
messages.msgSnippet: ran a program this evening on unschooling and I caught just the last couple minutes.  It was the Think Out Loud program and so I went to the website.  I m
messages.messageBody:
ran a program this evening on unschooling and I caught just the last
couple minutes. It was the Think Out Loud program and so I went to the
website. I'm finding on their message board that a lot of responses
from "unschoolers" are not describing unschooling as I know it. But if
you click on the highlighted word 'advocates' in the opb text you get
Sandra's website homepage, which is nice ;-) I haven't felt like
responding myself yet.....
Mary
